examples: Every person has the right to express their opinions and beliefs.
The manager struck a rather insincere note as he expressed his sorrow at the round of layoffs.
He wanted to express his appreciation for all they had done, but words failed him.
Women should feel free to speak their minds and express themselves.
It is important to create a supportive environment where children can express their thoughts and emotions freely.
words.defineEn: to show or make a thought, feeling, etc. known by looks, words, or actions
words.defineVi: để hiển thị hoặc làm cho một suy nghĩ, cảm giác, vv được biết đến bằng vẻ ngoài, lời nói hoặc hành động

examples: to control the traffic congestion
The state has taken control of the company.
The government has lost control of the city.
Her drinking problem is spinning out of control.
The CEO is the big wheel of the entire company, with control over all major decisions.
words.defineEn: to have power over a person, company, country, etc. and to decide how things should be done
words.defineVi: có quyền lực đối với một người, công ty, quốc gia, v.v. và quyết định mọi việc nên được thực hiện như thế nào

examples: Her comment about my work piqued my anger.
His apology took the edge off her anger.
He gritted his teeth in anger.
She was beside herself with anger.
The driver knew that anger and haste hinder good counsel when he was cut off in traffic.
words.defineEn: a strong feeling that we have when something bad has happened, so we might be unkind to someone or harm them
words.defineVi: một cảm giác mạnh mẽ mà chúng ta có khi điều gì đó tồi tệ đã xảy ra, vì vậy chúng ta có thể không tử tế với ai đó hoặc làm hại họ

words.phonetic: tə luːz wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs tɛmpɚ
words.defineVi: đột nhiên trở nên tức giận không thể kiểm soát

words.phonetic: tə hæv slæʃ θɹoʊ ɐ fɪt
words.defineEn: to be extremely angry and unable to relax or think logically
words.defineVi: cực kỳ tức giận và không thể thư giãn hoặc suy nghĩ logic

words.phonetic: tə hɪt ðə ɹuːf slæʃ siːlɪŋ
words.defineEn: to become extremely angry with someone or something
words.defineVi: để trở nên cực kỳ tức giận với một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó
đột nhiên trở nên vô cùng tức giận

words.phonetic: tə bloʊ wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs tɑːp slæʃ kuːl slæʃ stæk slæʃ lɪd
words.defineEn: to fail to control one's anger
words.defineVi: không thể kiểm soát sự tức giận của một người

examples: The next conference will be held in Ohio.
The wood is held in position by a clamp.
To be held in high esteem.
She was arrested and held in custody in a police station.
VidCon is held in Anaheim, California.
words.defineEn: to suppress the expression of your feelings
words.defineVi: để ngăn chặn sự thể hiện cảm xúc của bạn

examples: Calm down and stay where you are.
I got hold of myself and calmed down.
The parent who was angry at their child's teacher decided to take a few deep breaths and calm down before responding, remembering that one should say well or be still.
Calm down.
The bosses calmed down.
words.defineEn: to become less angry, upset, or worried
words.defineVi: để trở nên ít tức giận, khó chịu, hoặc lo lắng

words.defineEn: to free oneself from tension or anxiety and be more relaxed instead
words.defineVi: để giải phóng bản thân khỏi căng thẳng hoặc lo lắng và thay vào đó được thoải mái hơn

examples: He shrugged off the thought of his superiors dragging him over the coals for making such a statement to a civilian.
Some would say Facebook has largely shrugged off the responsibility to take action to fix these vulnerabilities because it would mean major changes to the platform.
So once they realize something feels unfamiliar about themselves, they end up with a prolonged, upsetting delusion that they’re dead, instead of shrugging off the idea as impossible.

Those adorable, indestructible, tiny teddy bears of the animal world can survive the complete vacuum in deadly radiation of space, go without eating for as long as a decade, and just shrug off temperatures ranging from minus 200 to 150 degrees Celsius.
words.defineEn: to consider something unworthy of one's attention or consideration
words.defineVi: để xem xét một cái gì đó không xứng đáng với sự chú ý hoặc xem xét của một người

words.phonetic: tə lɛt ɔf slæʃ bloʊ ɔf stiːm
words.defineEn: to get rid of one's strong feelings, particularly by talking in an angry way
words.defineVi: để thoát khỏi cảm xúc mạnh mẽ của một người, đặc biệt là bằng cách nói chuyện một cách tức giận

examples: Jack vented his spleen at his wife whenever things went badly at work.
Peter vented his spleen on his car by kicking it when it broke down.
I listened patiently while she vented her spleen.
Jack was struggling and found comfort in venting his problems to his brother Joe, looking for sympathy and validation.
Mom's been venting her spleen to me for an hour already.
words.defineEn: to strongly express one's feelings, particularly one's anger
words.defineVi: để thể hiện mạnh mẽ cảm xúc của một người, đặc biệt là sự tức giận của một người
